get_started.title: Get Started with Rainbow
get_started.description: Welcome to Rainbow! We're so glad you're here. We've created this guide to help with the basics of Rainbow and get you started on your new Web3 and Ethereum journey.

backups.title: The Importance of Backups
backups.description: Keeping your wallet safe, secure, and backed up is essential to wallet ownership. Here we‚Äôll chat about why it‚Äôs important to backup your wallet and the different methods that you can backup with.

crypto_and_wallets.title: Crypto and Wallets
crypto_and_wallets.description: On a really simple level, a wallet is just a personal and unique cryptographic key (as shown below). Wallet apps like Rainbow are user interfaces that allow you to create, store, and manage cryptographic keys without having to have technical skills or knowledge.

protect_wallet.title: Protect Your Wallet
protect_wallet.description: One of the best parts of having an Ethereum wallet like Rainbow is that you are in total control of your money. Unlike a bank account from Wells Fargo or a crypto exchange like Coinbase, we do not hold your assets on your behalf.

connect_to_dapp.title: Connect to a Website or App
connect_to_dapp.description: Now that you have an Ethereum wallet, you can login to certain websites using it. Instead of creating new accounts and passwords for every website you interact with, you'll just connect your wallet instead.

avoid_scams.title: Avoid Crypto Scams
avoid_scams.description: Here at Rainbow, one of our goals is to make exploring the new world of Ethereum fun, friendly, and safe. You know what's not any of those things? Scams. They're mean, and no one likes them. We want to help you avoid them, so we wrote this brief guide to help you do exactly that!

understanding_web3.title: Understanding Web3
understanding_web3.description: The internet has been evolving ever since it was created, and it has been through many eras. Web1 started during the 1990s, and it was a period marked by people connecting to the internet and reading what was there, but not publishing or contributing themselves.

manage_connections.title: Manage Connections and Networks
manage_connections.description: Many of the websites or applications you connect your wallet to require you to be using a specific network. Currently, most websites use the main Ethereum network and new connections to your wallet usually default to this network.

supported_networks.title: Supported Networks
supported_networks.description: Up until recently, Rainbow and many other blockchain projects have only been compatible with Ethereum‚Äîthe world's public decentralized ledger. Ethereum is extremely secure and highly reliable, but it isn't always well suited for speed and efficiency.

collect_nfts.title: Collect NFTs on OpenSea
collect_nfts.description: NFTs are digital collectibles that can be owned and traded. The acronym "NFT" stands for non-fungible token, and they can come in the form of anything from digital trading cards to digital art. There are even NFTs that act like certificates of authenticity for physical items.

ledger.title: Pair a Hardware Wallet
ledger.body: Connect your Ledger Nano X to Rainbow through Bluetooth.

receive.description:
You can also long press your
address above to copy it.

icon_unlock.golddoge_text: A limited edition golden Rainbow app icon in celebration of Kabosu's 17th birthday.

output_disabled.text:
For %{fromNetwork}, Rainbow can't prepare swaps based on the amount of %{outputToken} you'd like to receive. 

 Try entering the amount of %{inputToken} you‚Äôd like to swap instead.
output_disabled.title: Enter %{inputToken} Instead
output_disabled.text_crosschain:
Rainbow can't prepare swaps based on the amount of %{outputToken} you'd like to receive. 

 Try entering the amount of %{inputToken} you‚Äôd like to swap instead.
output_disabled.text_bridge:
Rainbow can't prepare a bridge based on the amount of %{outputToken} you'd like to receive at the %{toNetwork} destination. 

 Try entering the amount of %{fromNetwork} %{inputToken} you‚Äôd like to bridge instead.

available_networks.text: %{tokenSymbol} is available on %{networks}. To move %{tokenSymbol} between networks, use a Bridge like Hop.

arbitrum.text:
Arbitrum is a Layer 2 network that runs on top of Ethereum, enabling cheaper and faster transactions while still benefiting from the underlying security of Ethereum.

It bundles lots of transactions together in a "roll up" before sending them down to live permanently on Ethereum.
arbitrum.title: What's Arbitrum?

base_fee.text_prefix: The base fee is set by the Ethereum network and changes depending on how busy the network is.
base_fee.text_rising: Fees are rising right now! It‚Äôs best to use a higher max base fee to avoid a stuck transaction.
base_fee.text_stable: Network traffic is stable right now. Have fun!
base_fee.text_surging: Fees are unusually high right now! Unless your transaction is urgent, it‚Äôs best to wait for fees to drop.
base_fee.title: Current base fee

failed_walletconnect.text: Uh oh, something went wrong! The site may be experiencing a connection outage. Please try again later or contact the site‚Äôs team for more details.
failed_walletconnect.title: Connection failed

failed_wc_invalid_methods.text: The dapp requested wallet signing (RPC) methods that are unsupported by Rainbow.
failed_wc_invalid_methods.title: Connection failed

failed_wc_invalid_chains.text: The dapp requested network(s) that are unsupported by Rainbow.
failed_wc_invalid_chains.title: Connection failed

failed_wc_invalid_chain.text: The network specified in this request is not supported by Rainbow.
failed_wc_invalid_chain.title: Handling failed

floor_price.text: A collection's floor price is the lowest asking price across all the items currently for sale in a collection.
floor_price.title: Collection floor price

gas.text:
This is the "gas fee" used by the %{networkName} blockchain to securely validate your transaction.

This fee varies depending on the complexity of your transaction and how busy the network is!
gas.title: %{networkName} network fee

max_base_fee.text:
This is the maximum base fee you‚Äôre willing to pay for this transaction.

Setting a higher max base fee prevents your transaction from getting stuck if fees rise.
max_base_fee.title: Max base fee

miner_tip.text:
The miner tip goes directly to the miner who confirms your transaction on the network.

A higher tip makes your transaction more likely to be confirmed quickly.
miner_tip.title: Miner tip

optimism.text:
Optimism is a Layer 2 network that runs on top of Ethereum, enabling cheaper and faster transactions while still benefiting from the underlying security of Ethereum.

It bundles lots of transactions together in a "roll up" before sending them down to live permanently on Ethereum.
optimism.title: What's Optimism?

base.text:
Base is a Layer 2 network that runs on top of Ethereum, enabling cheaper and faster transactions while still benefiting from the underlying security of Ethereum.

It bundles lots of transactions together in a "roll up" before sending them down to live permanently on Ethereum.
base.title: What's Base

zora.text:
Zora is a Layer 2 network that runs on top of Ethereum, enabling cheaper and faster transactions while still benefiting from the underlying security of Ethereum.

It bundles lots of transactions together in a "roll up" before sending them down to live permanently on Ethereum.
zora.title: What's Zora?

polygon.text:
Polygon is a sidechain, a distinct network that runs alongside Ethereum and is compatible with it.

It allows for cheaper and faster transactions, but unlike Layer 2 networks, Polygon has its own security and consensus mechanisms that differ from Ethereum.
polygon.title: What's Polygon?

bsc.text:
Binance Smart Chain (BSC) is the blockchain for the trading platform Binance. 

BSC allows for cheaper and faster transactions, but unlike a Layer 2 network, it has its own security and consensus mechanisms that differ from Ethereum.
bsc.title: What's Binance Smart Chain?

sending_to_contract.text:
The address you entered is for a smart contract.

Except for rare situations, you probably shouldn't do this. You could lose your assets or they might go to the wrong place.

Double check the address, verify it with the recipient, or contact support first.
sending_to_contract.title: Hold your horses!

verified.text:
Tokens with a verified badge mean they have appeared on at least 3 other outside token lists.

Always do your own research to ensure you are interacting with a token you trust.
verified.title: Verified Tokens

unverified.fragment1:
Rainbow surfaces as many tokens as possible, but anyone can create a token, or claim to represent a project with a fake contract. 

 Please review the
unverified.fragment3: and always do research to ensure that you interact with tokens you trust.
unverified.title: %{symbol} is Unverified

obtain_l2_asset.fragment1:
You'll need to get other tokens on %{networkName} to swap for %{networkName} %{tokenName}. 

 Bridging tokens to %{networkName} is easy using a bridge like Hop. Still curious?
obtain_l2_asset.title: No Tokens on %{networkName}

insufficient_liquidity.fragment1:
The exchanges don't have enough of the tokens you requested to complete this transaction. 

 Still curious?
insufficient_liquidity.title: Insufficient Liquidity

fee_on_transfer.fragment1:
This swap will fail in Rainbow because the %{tokenName} contract adds extra fees.  

 Read
fee_on_transfer.title: Fee on Transfer Token

no_route_found.fragment1: We couldn‚Äôt find a route for this swap.
no_route_found.fragment2: A route may not exist for this swap, or the amount may be too small.
no_route_found.title: No routes found

no_quote.title: No quote available
no_quote.text: We couldn‚Äôt find quotes for this swap. This could be because there isn‚Äôt enough liquidity to swap or problems with how the token is implemented.

cross_chain_swap.title: Expect Bridge Delays
cross_chain_swap.text:
This swap may take longer than expected to complete. 

 Cross-chain swaps require bridging funds to the destination network, and bridges can sometimes take longer than expected to transfer funds. Your funds will remain safe during this time.

go_to_hop_with_icon.text: Go to the Hop Bridge ÙÄÆ∂

rainbow_fee.text: Rainbow takes a %{feePercentage} fee from swaps. It‚Äôs part of what enables us to give you the best Ethereum experience possible.

swap_routing.text: By default, Rainbow chooses the cheapest route possible for your swap. If you prefer to specifically use either 0x or 1inch, you can do that too.
swap_routing.title: Swap Routing

still_curious.fragment3: about our approach to routing swaps.

slippage.text:
Slippage occurs when the price of a swap changes during the time between you submitting your transaction and its confirmation. 

Setting a higher slippage tolerance increases the likelihood your swap will be successful, but may result in you getting a worse price.
slippage.title: Slippage

still_curious.fragment3: about slippage and how it affects swaps.

flashbots.text: Flashbots protects your transactions from frontrunning and sandwich attacks which might result in you getting a worse price or your transaction failing.
flashbots.title: Flashbots

still_curious.fragment3: about Flashbots and the protection it offers.

swap_refuel.title: No %{networkName} %{gasToken} detected
swap_refuel.text: You won‚Äôt be able to use %{networkName} without %{networkName} %{gasToken}. We can seamlessly bundle it with this bridge using about $3 of ETH from your wallet.

swap_refuel_deduct.title: No %{networkName} %{gasToken} detected
swap_refuel_deduct.text: You won‚Äôt be able to use %{networkName} without %{networkName} %{gasToken}. We can seamlessly bundle it with this bridge using about $3 of ETH subtracted from this swap.

swap_refuel_notice.title: No %{networkName} %{gasToken} detected
swap_refuel_notice.text: You won‚Äôt be able to use %{networkName} without %{networkName} %{gasToken}. If you go through with this transaction, you won‚Äôt be able to swap, bridge or transfer your %{networkName} tokens without adding %{networkName} %{gasToken} to your wallet.

reassurance.security: We work incredibly hard to make sure your funds are safe. This tool never touches your private keys, so that greatly reduces the surface area for attack. If you are familiar with programming, you can check out our code on GitHub.
reassurance.text_mobile: You need to use an Ethereum Wallet to access Balance Manager to view, send and exchange your Ether and Ethereum-based tokens.
reassurance.work: This is a web-based tool to help you manage the funds in your wallet. It does this by connecting to your wallet through its Application Programming Interface (API). Here are some important points about how we designed Balance Manager:

airdrop_timing.title: Airdrops Every Week
airdrop_timing.text: Swap on Optimism or bridge to Optimism to earn OP rewards. At the end of each week, the rewards you‚Äôve earned will be airdropped to your wallet.

amount_distributed.title: 67,850 OP Every Week
amount_distributed.text: Up to 67,850 OP in rewards will be distributed every week. If weekly rewards run out, rewards will temporarily pause and resume the following week.

bridge.title: Earn 0.125% on Bridging
bridge.text:
While rewards are live, bridging verified tokens to Optimism will earn you approximately 0.125% back in OP.

Stats update periodically throughout the day. Check back soon if you don‚Äôt see your recent bridging reflected here.

swap.title: Earn 0.425% on Swaps
swap.text:
While rewards are live, swapping verified tokens on Optimism will earn you approximately 0.425% back in OP.

Stats update periodically throughout the day. Check back soon if you don‚Äôt see your recent swaps reflected here.

position.title: Leaderboard Position
position.text: The more OP you earn by swapping and bridging, the higher you‚Äôll climb on the leaderboard. If you‚Äôre in the top 100 at the end of the contest, you‚Äôll get bonus rewards of up to 8,000 OP.

hardware_wallets.connected_and_ready: Your ledger is connected, please review and confirm the transaction on your device.
hardware_wallets.make_sure_bluetooth_enabled: Make sure you have Bluetooth enabled and your Ledger Nano X is unlocked.
hardware_wallets.almost_done: Almost done. Before you finish you need to enable blind signing on your Ledger device.
hardware_wallets.blind_signing_description: Blind signing enables your device to approve signing a smart contract transactions.

step_1.title: On Ledger, open the ETH app
step_1.description: Connect and unlock your device and open the Ethereum (ETH) application.

step_2.title: Navigate to settings
step_2.description: Press the right button to navigate to Settings. Then press both buttons to validate your Ledger device displays Blind Signing.

step_3.title: Enable blind signing
step_3.description: Press both buttons to enable blind signing for transactions. If the device displays Enabled, you're good to go.

hardware_wallets.open_eth_app_description: The Ethereum app needs to be open on your Ledger to proceed with the transaction.
hardware_wallets.enter_passcode: Enter your passcode to unlock your Ledger. Once unlocked, open the Ethereum app by pressing both buttons at once.

errors.off_or_locked: Make sure your device is unlocked
errors.no_eth_app: Open the Eth App on your device
errors.unknown: Unknown Error, close and reopen this sheet

alert.current_authentication_not_secure_enough: Your current authentication method (Face Recognition) is not secure enough, please go to "Settings > Biometrics & Security" and enable an alternative biometric method like Fingerprint or Iris.

secret.these_words_are_for_your_eyes_only:
These words are for your eyes only. Your secret phrase gives access to your entire wallet. 

       Be very careful with it.

errors.generic_error: Something went wrong. Please try again, or reach out to our support team.
errors.pairing_timeout: This session timed-out before a connection could be established. This is usually due to a network error. Please try again.
errors.pairing_unsupported_methods: The dapp requested wallet RPC methods that are unsupported by Rainbow.
errors.pairing_unsupported_networks: The dapp requested network(s) that are unsupported by Rainbow.
errors.read_only_wallet_on_signing_method: It looks like you're using a read-only wallet, which is not allowed for this request.
errors.namespaces_invalid: There was an issue with the namespaces requested by the dapp. Please try again or contact Rainbow and/or dapp support teams.
errors.request_invalid: The request contained invalid parameters. Please try again or contact Rainbow and/or dapp support teams.
errors.request_unsupported_network: The network specified in this request is not supported by Rainbow.
errors.request_unsupported_methods: The RPC method(s) specified in this request are not supported by Rainbow.
